title: Ticket #1727: Windows install does not add condor_kbdd to the DAEMON_LIST
description: My desktop computer, dhanu, is running WinXP. Last night it received some updates, including Condor. This morning on login, I see a Windows Security Alert that Windows Firewall is blocking the condor_kbdd. The condor_kbdd doesn't show up in my DAEMON_LIST.
remarks:
2010-Oct-28 08:42:09 by tstclair:
I believe this is normal for later versions because the kbdd is not started under master. It's lauched as a user level service. As far as the fw punch goes, I'm not 100% certain how the old installer & master behaved if it wasn't in the DAEMON_LIST, Z would have to answer this.

2010-Oct-28 15:05:41 by ziliang:
TJ and I already spoke to Becky about this. Looking at the code, if the STARTD got added to DAEMON_LIST, then KBDD should also have been added. But whether KBDD is part of DAEMON_LIST should be irrelevant to firewall punching, since that code checks to see if it is an execute node when it tries to figure out who to punch holes for.

2011-May-13 16:27:48 by ziliang:
Resolved. CSL maintains their own list of firewall exceptions for applications. Whether we punched a hole or not was irrelevant.
creator: bgietzel
